availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Crutcher Ireland (Greenup County, Kentucky, attorney and politician)

body.p: Greenup County, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Mason County, Kentucky, native. Son of Samuel D. Ireland and Sarah Crutcher Ireland. Married to Pamelia D. Robb Ireland in 1848. Father of Virginia L. Ireland, Sallie D. Ireland, and W. C. Ireland. Attended school in Mason County, Kentucky, and Lewis County, Kentucky. Clerked in a Maysville, Kentucky, store. Studied law in Clarksburg, Kentucky, from 1845 to 1848. Admitted to the bar in Lewis County in 1848. Began legal practice in Greenup County in 1852. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in Greenup County from 1859 to 1863. Assistant clerk for the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1863 to 1865.

ab.bibl: The Biographical Encyclop√¶dia of Kentucky of the Dead and Living Men of the Nineteenth Century, vol. 1 (Cincinnati, OH: J. M. Armstrong and Co., 1878), p. 500-503. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lewis County, District 1, p. 240. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, East Little Sandy, Subdistrict 2, p. 2. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyd County, Ashland, p. 33. Find A Grave, "Judge William Crutcher Ireland (1823-1894)," Memorial #74205273, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/74205273/william-crutcher-ireland (accessed June 15, 2017).
